proveL2LeafInclusionShared(uint256,uint2.details: Proves that a certain leaf was included as part of the log merkle tree.Warning: this function does not enforce any additional checks on the structure of the leaf. This means that it can accept intermediate nodes of the Merkle tree as a `_leaf` as well as the default "empty" leaves. It is the responsibility of the caller to ensure that the `_leaf` is a hash of a valid leaf.

params._blockOrBatchNumber: The batch/block number of the leaf to be proven.
params._chainId: The chain id of the L2 where the leaf comes from.

params._blockOrBatchNumber: The executed L2 batch/block number in which the log appeared.
params._chainId: The chain id of the L2 where the log comes from.
params._index: The position of the l2log in the L2 logs Merkle tree.
params._proof: Merkle proof for inclusion of the L2 log.

returns._0: Whether the proof is correct and L2 log is included in batch.

params._blockOrBatchNumber: The executed L2 batch/block number in which the message appeared.
params._chainId: The chain id of the L2 where the message comes from.
params._index: The position in the L2 logs Merkle tree of the l2Log that was sent with the message.
params._message: Information about the sent message: sender address, the message itself, tx index in the L2 batch where the message was sent.
params._proof: Merkle proof for inclusion of L2 log that was sent with the message.

returns._0: Boolean specifying whether the proof is valid.

proveL2LogInclusionShared(uint256,uint25.notice: Prove that a specific L2 log was sent in a specific L2 batch.

proveL2MessageInclusionShared(uint256,ui.notice: Prove that a specific arbitrary-length message was sent in a specific L2 batch/block number.
